intro: Cionosicys pomiformis, commonly known as the apple-shaped liverwort, is a species of leafy liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, rounded thallus that resembles a small apple, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its structure consists of a central stem with lateral branches and a dense covering of gametophytic leaves. Cionosicys pomiformis plays a role in soil stabilization and serves as a habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
